parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To hasten, be eager, be zealous. From spoude; to use speed, i.e. To make effort, be prompt or earnest.
Or prolonged paristano from para and histemi; to stand beside, i.e. to exhibit, proffer, recommend, substantiate; or to be at hand, aid.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 2nd Person Singular

str2: Approved, acceptable, tried. From dokeo; properly, acceptable, i.e. Approved.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
Having no cause to be ashamed. Not ashamed, i.e. Irreprehensible.
A field-laborer; then: a laborer, workman in general. From ergon; a toiler; figuratively, a teacher.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: From a compound of orthos and the base of tomoteros, to make a straight cut, i.e. to dissect correctly.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From lego; something said; by implication, a topic, also reasoning or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, the Divine Expression.
